title: Quick Reminder That Hustlers Is the Most Important Movie of 2019
text:
Sure, it's the day after Labor Day; you've packed up all your white jeans for the season, vacuumed all the sand out of your backseats, and traded in the sunscreen for seasonal drinks (yes I have already had a pumpkin-flavored cold brew, stay out of it). But the new Hustlers trailer is here to remind you that summer is simply a state of mind—especially Hot Girl Summer, which, Hustlers seems to argue, is an aspirational lifestyle, not just a three-month span of time in which we can all truly feel ourselves.

In case you've missed my unwell rants about Hustlers on basically every form of social media that'll let me talk about it, the movie—out September 13, mark your calendars and start preparing your minds and bodies now—is based on an exceptional New York article by Jessica Pressler about a group of entrepreneurial strippers who turn to a life of light crime to bankroll their extravagant lifestyles. That involves, of course, mildly drugging some Wall Street execs' drinks, running up their credit cards, and celebrating into the wee hours of the night. You love to see it!

The film adaptation stars—deep breath here—Cardi B, Lizzo, Trace Lysette, Usher, Jennifer Lopez (as Ramona, and honestly, give her an EGOT), Constance Wu, Julia Stiles, Keke Palmer, Lili Reinhart, Jon Glaser, and more. The new trailer, the final one before the film's wide release next week, shows us a deeper glimpse of Cardi B's character, Diamond from the Bronx, who's tasked by Lopez to teach Wu's Destiny how to give a "real dance." More than anything, it shows off the movie's willingness to let loose and have fun. Remember when you'd go to the movies and let loose? When the whole cast seemed like they were having the times of their lives filming the thing? When you left feeling light and refreshed and smiling? Yeah, Hustlers seems like it's that kind of movie. That and the fact that the trailer is set to Cardi B's "Money" means... you should just start queuing up now.

Watch the final Hustlers trailer below and catch it in theaters on September 13.
